dialogues.text: He left before I did... Charlie glances up and spots Bob, who's running towards t and talk...

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: Where were you?

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: I'm here. MIKE (cont'd) They just left.  I told 'em your back went out, so if you or something...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Jeff, any calls?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yeah...Charlie.  He's moving Sydney in... (looks at his watch) ...about now...wants him comfortable by the dedication...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Fine.  Talk to me about the pipes?

dialogues.speaker: MIKE
dialogues.text: They're in, waterfall will be on time... Bob looks up and sees Marty walking through the zoo...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: You guys go ahead... (yells) Marty! Bob walks to join Marty... Marty sits on a bench, admirin habitat... A lush green, natural environment.  There are pond, small waterfall... It's a "Garden of Eden".  A happ on one of the large Oak trees.

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: I'd live here...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's nice, isn't it?  You alone?

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Yes... (gestures Bob to sit) Gotta minute? Bob glances back at Mike and Jeff, who are now busy with

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (he sits) Yeah sure...

dialogues.speaker: MARTY
dialogues.text: Now Robert, this is none of my business.  I know what has overwhelming and you need time to sort it all out... But sorting, just know, that when I prayed and prayed for Gra another chance at life... I knew that if God blessed us, have to be from someone very special, if it's to be at ho Grace...when she met you...her heart beat truly, for the Marty in a fatherly way, puts his hand on Bob's shoulder. leave... MARTY (cont'd) Perhaps it was meant to be with you always... Marty slowly walks away, leaving Bob to his thoughts. As Bob looks up at the habitat, Sydney is sitting in the staring at him... Bob does the "sign" for "Hi".  Sydney s back... Bob's not sure what.  Sydney repeats the sign... goes to a DISPLAY illustrating the proper "sign" for each ALPHABET. He looks up at Sydney, who impatiently "signs" the same m looks to the board and matches the first letter... "G". Sydney, who hits his chest and "signs" again.  Bob glance board... "O".

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: (spinning around) Marty! Bob starts to run after Marty... Charlie comes around the Bob running... He turns to Sydney...who repeats the "G" - laughs.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (to Sydney) You can go in there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two historic fountains, on either end of the Piazza, by ARTISTS painting on canvases. A group of THREE NUNS stops at Grace's easel... they "ooh "ahh"...Grace sits in front of a blank canvas.  She turns

dialogues.speaker: NUN
dialogues.text: Bicicletta...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh...my bike... Grace moves the easel so they can see the whole bike...

dialogues.speaker: NUN
dialogues.text: Que belisima...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Oh thank you...grazi. The nuns gather 'round it...admiring the basket...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Would you like to ride it?

dialogues.speaker: NUN
dialogues.text: Oh...no-no-no... Grace walks the bike out a bit and kicks up the kick-stan

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: Please...

dialogues.speaker: NUN
dialogues.text: (getting on the bike) No-no-no... (she rings the bell, turns to the other nuns) Una momento... And she rides off ringing the bell...pigeons scatter...

dialogues.speaker: AT THE FAR SIDE OF THE SQUARE,
dialogues.text: Bob searches through the sea of Artists in the square, so others on the ground, some sitting on the ledges of the f hears a bell and turns... The nun goes riding past on the bike... Bob squints his e what he just saw... He curiously follows...is that Grace' picks up his pace... The nun negotiates the turn around a fountain.  Bob start her... the two disappear into the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE BACK AT THE EASEL,
dialogues.text: She prepares her paints while the nuns look patiently thr crowd for a sign of their friend... One of them starts to points... Grace turns to look... We see the nun on the handle bars, her habit flapping in Grace and the two nuns watch as the bike slows and stops them... The nun hops off the handle bars, revealing Bob, little winded.. As he gets off the bike...

dialogues.speaker: NUN
dialogues.text: (To Grace, indicating Bob) Tu Amour?

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (eyes fill with tears) Si... The three nuns stand there watching as Grace runs to Bob. embrace...

dialogues.speaker: GRACE
dialogues.text: (smiling through her tears) You came all the way to Italy...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Yeah... I did.  I came all the way to Italy... (not letting go) I love you, Grace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dedication ceremony, already in progress.  Bob and Ch the stage as a respectable-sized CROWD, patiently listens Bennington, who nears the end of his long-winded speech..

dialogues.speaker: MR. BENNINGTON
dialogues.text: ...but my money is not what we are here to talk about... Bob sees Marty, Wally, Emmett and Angelo, all with their hands, dressed in their Sunday best... He winks at Grace. MR. BENNINGTON (cont'd) So it is with great pleasure, I introduce you to the man this beautifully designed Gorilla Habitat, Mr. Bob Ruelan A nice round of applause from the crowd, Bob goes to the.

dialogues.speaker: PODIUM,
dialogues.text: Behind him, the large PHOTO of KATHERINE AND SYDNEY.  (Th Katherine showed at "The A.R.T.S. Benefit Dinner".) All eyes are on Bob...

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mr. Bennington, for the introduction and your Bennington stands and takes a bow. BOB (cont'd) I'd like to thank everyone who has contributed their time incredibly dedicated crew, Lincoln Park's Board of Direct Supervising Veterinarian, my dear friend, Dr. Charles Joh Courteous applause. BOB (cont'd) The dedication of this new home for Sydney and his family meaning for me...personally.  My wife... Katherine... Dr. Rueland, spent many years with Sydney... He was found wou poachers, it was Katherine who nursed him back to health. (looking at Grace) But most importantly, it was her uncompromising passion t all here today. Grace smiles up at Bob, Marty takes her hand, squeezes it

dialogues.speaker: BOB
dialogues.text: So it is with great honor that I dedicate this habitat in of Dr. Katherine Rueland... APPLAUSE. THE CAMERA, still holding on Bob, slowly RISES up and awa FILL OUR FRAME... FADE TO WHITE.
